bug.author: analog-cbarber
bug.summary: Cannot refer to LaneChange.None because None is a reserved word
bug.description: In CARLA 0.9.4, the LaneChange enum has a value None, but because that is a reserved word in Python, there is no way to refer to this value using normal Python syntax: >>> import carla >>> carla.LaneChange.None File "<input>", line 1 carla.LaneChange.None ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax If you want to test a LaneChange to see if it has this value, you have to use the name attribute: if lane_change.name == 'None': ... It would be better if you picked a different name for this value.
